description:
I took this photograph in May, during a quick visit to my hometown of New Orleans. The picture depicts palm trees completely immersed in water during a freak storm which caused water to rush over the levees near New Orleans. 

Obviously, things much worse than this have become more and more frequent over the decades, and the hurricanes become worse and worse every time. 

Due to the greed and evil of oil executives, the Gulf Coast along with the rest of the world is being destroyed right in front of our eyes.

90% of all proceeds go directly to the Hurricane Ida Relief fund, organized by "Another Gulf Is Possible"
https://anothergulf.com/

2005 editions for the year I lost my home and moved north.
